notes: This file is owned by Agent 13 only.
Structure nests rounds inside sprints to keep history organized.

wk1_r1.prompt_text: Draft patch notes for Build A and Build B using the template; highlight 3 bullets per build plus known issues.

response.raw:
## Build A (Midweek) — Patch Notes Draft

### Title
**Kingdom Sim — Week 1 Broad Sweep (Build A / Midweek)**

### Highlights
- **Hero clarity**: Hero panel now exposes **Current intent** + **Last decision** (action + short reason + age).
- **Bounty clarity**: Bounties show **Responders: N** and a deterministic **Attractiveness** tier (Low/Med/High).
- **Debuggability**: Added safe instrumentation/logging so you can answer “why did that hero do that?” without guesswork.

### Gameplay & Balance
- (If shipped) Minor bounty cost/reward adjustments to improve early leverage without destabilizing pacing.

### AI Behavior
- Introduced/standardized intent labels (e.g., `idle`, `pursuing_bounty`, `shopping`, `returning_to_safety`, `engaging_enemy`, `defending_building`, `attacking_lair`).
- Last-decision record now stores a short reason string and a sim-time “age” value (works in **LLM**, **mock**, and **--no-llm**).

### UI/UX
- Hero panel: shows **Intent** and **Last decision** with a safe placeholder when none exists yet.
- Bounty overlay/UI: shows **Responders** and **Attractiveness** in a compact, non-spammy format.

### Visuals
- (Optional) Small iconography/shape language for bounty attractiveness tiers (placeholder-friendly).

### Performance & Stability
- No new crashes/softlocks in `--no-llm` and `--provider mock`.
- Guardrail: new “age/time since decision” uses **sim-time/ticks**, not wall-clock.

### Known Issues (draft — update as QA runs)
- (If observed) UI overlap at small resolutions when multiple bounties are clustered.
- (If observed) Some heroes may show “No decision yet” briefly after spawn (expected).

### How to test (quick)
- `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick`
- Manual 10-minute smoke: boot → place a building → observe peasants build → hire a hero → place a bounty → confirm responders + intent/decision fields update → pause/resume → quit.

---

## Build B (Endweek) — Patch Notes Draft

### Title
**Kingdom Sim — Week 1 Broad Sweep (Build B / Endweek)**

### Highlights
- **Early pacing guardrail**: within ~3 minutes, the game surfaces at least one clear decision prompt (without a difficulty spike).
- **Balance polish**: early wave pressure + bounty reward bands tuned to feel active but fair.
- **Stability/perf pass**: reduced overhead from new overlays/scans; expanded smoke coverage for new features.

### Gameplay & Balance
- Early-game pacing adjusted (warmup/pressure) to reduce dead air while staying recoverable.
- Bounty costs/rewards refined so bounties feel like a reliable lever across low/med/high targets.
- (If shipped) Lair-related payouts/costs sanity-checked to avoid runaway snowballing.

### AI Behavior
- Intent and last-decision tracking polished for consistency and readability.
- Bounty attractiveness scoring confirmed deterministic (no RNG / wall-clock dependencies).

### UI/UX
- Clarity polish: reduced UI spam/overlap; tightened copy for intent and decision reasons.
- Debug panel (if enabled) includes intent/decision fields for quick triage.

### Performance & Stability
- Reduced per-frame allocations in overlays (cached formatting where possible).
- Prevented O(N_heroes * N_bounties) behavior via caps/short-circuiting (as applicable).
- Expanded `tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` assertions around:
  - bounty responder updates
  - non-empty hero intent after a short runtime
  - no exceptions in mock/no-LLM paths

### Known Issues (draft — update at ship)
- (If observed) Some edge cases where responder count lags for 1–2 ticks after retargeting.
- (If observed) Rare UI jitter when rapidly panning camera over dense overlays.

### How to test (quick)
- `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick`
- Manual 10-minute smoke: boot → build → peasants construct → hire hero → place bounty → verify responders/attractiveness → observe 1–2 waves → pause/resume → quit.
summary_bullets: Build A: player-facing clarity (hero intent + last decision) and bounty legibility (responders + attractiveness).
Build B: early pacing guardrail + balance polish + stability/perf pass and expanded smoke coverage.
Both: include quick test steps and placeholders for QA-confirmed known issues before posting.
proposed_changes: Publish Build A midweek announcement after UI/intent/bounty features merge and QA smoke passes.
Publish Build B endweek announcement after pacing/tuning/perf changes merge and QA confirms no regressions.
Standardize Steam post format using the shared patch-notes template for cadence.
acceptance_criteria: Each build note includes 3 headline highlights and sectioned breakdown (Gameplay/AI/UI/Perf/Known Issues).
No claims in public notes that are not verified by merged code + QA results.
Known issues section exists and is updated with QA-confirmed issues at ship time.
risks: Overstating tuning/perf results before measurement or QA confirmation.
Listing features that slip out of the build due to scope changes.
Known issues list incomplete without QA feedback loop.
Forgetting to include the short mock/no-LLM reminder in the public post (PM decision).
dependencies: Final merged change list for Build A (publish as Prototype v1.2.1).
Final merged change list for Build B (publish as Prototype v1.2.2, including early pacing guardrail description).
QA known-issues list + confirmation that `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` and manual 10-minute smoke passed for each build.
recommended_next_actions: After Build A merge + QA: update draft to Prototype v1.2.1 announcement-ready copy (only verified bullets) + QA-confirmed known issues; include mock/no-LLM reminder; publish.
After Build B merge + QA: update draft to Prototype v1.2.2 announcement-ready copy + early pacing guardrail description + QA-confirmed known issues; include mock/no-LLM reminder; publish.
Prepare (optional) pinned Steam discussion post: ‘How to run mock/no-LLM (no API keys)’ and link it in both announcements.

patch_notes_build_a: Hero panel shows Current intent + Last decision (action + short reason + age).
Bounties display Responders count and deterministic Attractiveness tier (Low/Med/High).
Added safe instrumentation to make hero behavior explainable; includes quick test steps.
patch_notes_build_b: Early pacing guardrail surfaces a clear decision prompt within ~3 minutes without a difficulty spike.
Balance polish: early pressure + bounty reward bands tuned to feel active but fair.
Stability/perf pass: reduce overlay overhead; expand smoke coverage for intent/bounty/responder updates.
known_issues: (Build A placeholder) Possible UI overlap at small resolutions when bounties cluster; ‘No decision yet’ briefly after spawn.
(Build B placeholder) Responder count may lag 1–2 ticks after retarget; rare UI jitter when panning over dense overlays.

wk2_r1.prompt_text: WK2 Kickoff (Round 1 / wk2_r1): Reference plan .cursor/plans/wk2-hero-polish-ai-sprites_5318e148.plan.md. Provide acceptance criteria/contracts/repro/QA harness; log response using REPLY template structure.

response.raw:
### Status
Agent 13 (SteamRelease_Ops_Marketing) — producing WK2 Build A/Build B patch-note scaffolds and release-facing acceptance criteria. I will not publish/claim any bullet publicly until the deterministic repro + `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` gate is green and the shipped change list is finalized.

### Deliverables
- Draft player-facing patch notes for WK2 Build A (AI polish) and Build B (hero sprites), including a standard **No API keys required** section and a small **How to test** snippet.
- A short release-copy checklist for what must be verified before posting (QA-confirmed known issues, verified bullets only).

### Proposed changes (file boundaries)
- Add/update sprint patch-note drafts (docs only):
  - `docs/sprint/wk2_buildA_patch_notes_draft.md`
  - `docs/sprint/wk2_buildB_patch_notes_draft.md`
- (Optional, later) Prepare a pinned Steam discussion copy: ‘How to run mock/no-LLM (no API keys)’ in `docs/steam/` for easy reuse.

### Acceptance criteria + exact test commands
- Build A announcement only after:
  - `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` passes
  - Manual 10-minute smoke in `python main.py --no-llm` AND `python main.py --provider mock`
  - Verified: no attacks execute while hero is inside buildings
  - Verified: stuck recovery triggers in the deterministic repro scenario (per Tools/QA harness), and heroes do not remain frozen for long spans
- Build B announcement only after:
  - All 4 classes have sprite folders populated (no missing fallbacks): `assets/sprites/heroes/{warrior,ranger,rogue,wizard}/{idle,walk,attack,hurt,inside}/frame_###.png`
  - `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` passes
  - Manual 10-minute smoke (mock/no-LLM): confirm animations match state (idle/walk/attack/hurt/inside), no jittery state-flipping

### Risks
- Publishing bullets that aren’t fully verified by QA + deterministic scenario results.
- Versioning drift (prototype versions) if Build tags are renumbered late.
- Sprite pipeline issues causing missing assets or inconsistent frame naming (would make patch notes inaccurate).

### Dependencies (blockers only)
- PM: confirm Prototype version numbers for WK2 Build A/Build B once scope is locked (or allow placeholder v1.2.x until tag).
- QA/Tools: deterministic repro scenario command + pass/fail criteria for stuck recovery and inside-combat gating.

### Questions back to PM (blockers only; otherwise [])
[]

### Next actions
- Keep patch-note drafts updated as Build A/B scope locks; replace placeholders with QA-confirmed known issues at ship time.
- When Tools/QA publish the deterministic repro command, include it verbatim in the announcement ‘How to test’ section (optional).
summary_bullets: Prepared WK2 Build A/B patch-note scaffolds: Build A = hero AI jank fixes; Build B = 4-class sprite animations.
Release-facing gate: publish only verified bullets after deterministic repro + `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` and manual smoke are green.
Includes standard ‘No API keys required’ run modes for every Steam-facing post.
proposed_changes: Optionally add a reusable pinned post draft explaining mock/no-LLM modes (docs-only).
acceptance_criteria: Build A post: `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` passes + manual smoke in `--no-llm` and `--provider mock`; claims limited to what shipped.
Build B post: sprite folders populated for all 4 classes and 5 states; `qa_smoke --quick` passes; manual animation/state verification completed.
Every post contains ‘No API keys required’ section and a short ‘How to test’ snippet.
risks: Overstating behavior improvements without deterministic repro confirmation.
Version number mismatch if tag naming changes late.
Sprite naming/folder convention mistakes causing missing frames (invalidating release notes).
dependencies: PM-confirmed Prototype version tags for WK2 Build A and Build B (or permission to keep placeholder v1.2.x until tag).
Deterministic repro scenario command from Tools + QA pass/fail assertions for stuck recovery and inside-combat gating.
Final merged change lists for each build to replace placeholders with verified bullets.
recommended_next_actions: After PM scope lock: confirm whether to label WK2 builds as v1.2.3/v1.2.4 (or other) before publishing.
After Tools/QA publish scenario command: add it to ‘How to test’ sections for both builds (if useful for players/devlog).
At ship time: replace placeholders with QA-confirmed known issues and remove any unverified claims.

patch_notes_build_a: Less hero jank: reduced rapid oscillation (goal/target commitment windows).
No combat while inside buildings (attack/damage gated).
patch_notes_build_b: Full hero sprite sets for Warrior/Ranger/Rogue/Wizard (idle/walk/attack/hurt/inside).
Animation readability improved (state matches intent; reduced jitter).

wk3_r1.prompt_text: WK3 Kickoff (Round 1 / wk3_r1) — UI Polish + 1080p Borderless + Pixel Art. Provide acceptance criteria + contracts + asset conventions + perf/QA gates (not big implementation). Default launch is borderless 1920×1080 (fallback if smaller). CC0/open-license assets allowed with clean attribution. qa_smoke --quick must remain PASS.

response.raw:
### Status
Agent 13 (SteamRelease_Ops_Marketing) — WK3 Round 1: define attribution/credits conventions for CC0/open-license pixel art, and seed patch-notes scaffolds for Build A (1080p borderless + UI skeleton) and Build B (pixel art ingestion + attribution).

### Deliverables
- Attribution standard doc with required repo file locations + patch-notes ‘Credits’ snippet.
- WK3 Build A/B patch-notes draft files (docs-only) that encode the release gates and borderless 1080p messaging.

### Proposed changes (file boundaries)
Docs-only changes (safe, no gameplay coupling):
- `docs/assets/attribution_standard.md` (repo conventions + patch-notes credits snippet)
- `docs/release/patch_notes_template.md` (adds Credits/Attribution section)
- `docs/sprint/wk3_buildA_patch_notes_draft.md`
- `docs/sprint/wk3_buildB_patch_notes_draft.md`

### Acceptance criteria + exact test commands
Release/announce only after:
- `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` is PASS
- Manual smoke (10 min each):
  - `python main.py --no-llm`
  - `python main.py --provider mock`
Build A acceptance for messaging:
- Default launch is **borderless 1920×1080**; if display is smaller, fallback uses display resolution while staying borderless.
- UI is readable at 1920×1080 with no overlapping critical panels.
Build B acceptance for messaging:
- Pixel art sprites are present for current heroes/enemies/buildings where added; fallbacks remain acceptable for missing frames.
- Attribution is complete: `assets/ATTRIBUTION.md` plus per-pack license/readme stored under `assets/third_party/<pack_name>/`.

### Risks
- License/attribution drift (assets merged without the required license text or source URL).
- Patch notes claim ‘pixel art for everything’ while some types still fallback (must be precise).

### Dependencies (blockers only)
- Agent 12: final asset ingestion/validation tooling conventions (folder naming, required states) so the Credits list can be generated/verified consistently.
- Agent 3: any locked contract for window scaling/UI scale behavior (so Build A messaging matches reality).

### Questions back to PM (blockers only)
[]

### Next actions
- When Agent 12 posts the exact pack list and directories touched, I will draft the exact Credits bullets to paste into Build B patch notes.
- When Agent 3 finalizes window/scaling behavior, I will tighten Build A patch-note wording (especially fallback behavior).
summary_bullets: Established attribution/credits conventions for CC0/open-license asset ingestion (repo file layout + patch-notes snippet).
Seeded WK3 Build A/B patch-notes drafts with borderless 1080p messaging and release gates.
Flagged blockers-only dependencies: window scaling contract (Agent 3) and final asset conventions/tooling (Agent 12).
proposed_changes: Add a Credits/Attribution section to patch notes template and use it for Build B.
Maintain WK3 Build A/B patch-notes drafts and update them only with verified, shipped bullets.
acceptance_criteria: Build A: launches borderless 1920×1080 by default with smaller-display fallback; UI readable at 1080p without critical overlap.
Build B: any ingested packs have complete attribution (rollup + per-pack license/readme) and patch notes include a short Credits section.
risks: Assets merged without complete license/source documentation (compliance risk).
Overbroad release claims (e.g., ‘pixel art for everything’) if fallbacks remain for some entities.
dependencies: Agent 12: final asset conventions + validation rules + list of packs used (so credits can be exact).
Agent 3: confirmed UI scaling/window fallback behavior to avoid mismatch in public messaging.
Final merged change list per build before publishing.
recommended_next_actions: After Agent 12 selects packs: record pack name/author/license/source in `assets/ATTRIBUTION.md` and mirror license/readme files under `assets/third_party/`.
After Agent 3 finalizes display/scaling: update Build A patch-notes wording to match the exact fallback behavior.
At ship time: keep release notes precise (call out which entity sets received pixel art vs which still fallback).

response.raw:
### Status
Agent 13 (SteamRelease_Ops_Marketing) — wk3_r6 Build B kickoff: added attribution scaffolding and locked the exact Credits bullet format we will use in Steam patch notes once Agent 09/12 finalize pack selection.

### Deliverables
- `assets/ATTRIBUTION.md` skeleton (required rollup) including the exact Steam Credits bullet structure.
- `assets/third_party/README.md` describing required per-pack license/provenance layout.

### Credits bullets format (exact)
Use one bullet per pack:
- `<Pack Name>` by `<Author>` — License: `<License>` — Source: `<URL>` — Used for: `<heroes/enemies/buildings/ui>`

### Required repo layout (once packs are chosen)
- `assets/ATTRIBUTION.md` must list each pack with: author, license, source, retrieved date, modifications, and exact `assets/sprites/...` directories used.
- For each pack: `assets/third_party/<pack_name>/LICENSE*.txt` (verbatim) and `README.txt` (verbatim or provenance note).

### Files changed
- `assets/ATTRIBUTION.md`
- `assets/third_party/README.md`

### Commands run + PASS evidence
- `python tools/qa_smoke.py --quick` (repo root)
  - PASS evidence: `[determinism_guard] PASS: no violations found` and multiple `[qa] PASS:` lines in the captured output log.

### Blockers
[]

### Next actions
- When Agent 09/12 lock the pack list, I will fill in `assets/ATTRIBUTION.md` with exact per-pack entries and provide the final Credits section for Build B patch notes.
